DOCNAME: CASE OF CONSTANTIN AND STOIAN v. ROMANIA
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Damage - claim dismissed

TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively . The first applicant lives in GPE , and the second in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor started criminal proceedings against “ PERSON and “ Florin ” , later identified as the applicants , based on information that they were trafficking in drugs . No other details were given in this decision of the prosecutor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police division responsible for the fight against organised crime and drug trafficking ( “ the police ” ) sought authorisation from the prosecutor ’s office to use an undercover agent and to obtain QUANTITY of heroin in order to gather evidence of the applicants’ alleged involvement in drug trafficking . It relied on PERSON no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on the fight against drug trafficking and illegal drug use ( “ Law no . CARDINAL ” ) . DATE , the organised crime and drug trafficking section of the prosecutor ’s office at ORG ( “ the prosecutor ’s office ” ) authorised the operation for DATE and handed over QUANTITY of heroin to the undercover agent ( referred to in the domestic proceedings as “ FAC ” ) .

CARDINAL . NORP The police set up the surveillance operation in the car park of ORG PERSON ( GPE ) , where the trafficking was thought to happen . Meanwhile PERSON , a police collaborator ( referred to in the domestic proceedings as “ FAC ” ) , set up a meeting with the first applicant , whom he had known previously .

CARDINAL . At CARDINAL PERSON arrived by car in the parking area together with PERSON . The first applicant and another man were sitting in another car . PERSON CARDINAL got out and approached the applicant ; he was to tell him that Alex CARDINAL , whom the applicant did not know , wanted to contact a person who could sell him QUANTITY of heroin . After a short talk , PERSON returned accompanied by the first applicant ; the latter then left by car with PERSON . The police followed the car until it stopped in front of a building on FAC . The applicant made a phone call from PERSON mobile phone . He left the car and entered the building , where he remained for TIME . He then returned with the second applicant to PERSON car . The first applicant took the right front seat , while the second applicant remained standing near the right front door of the car . PERSON handed money to the first applicant ; the latter passed it to the second applicant who took it and walked away .

CARDINAL . At that moment the police got out of their cars and shouted : “ Police , stop ! ” . The second applicant started running , abandoning his jacket and the money . He managed to escape into CARDINAL of the neighbouring buildings .

CARDINAL . The first applicant was identified and searched . CARDINAL tablets of methadone were found on him . He admitted that the tablets belonged to him and declared that he was a rehabilitated drug user and was authorised to take methadone . A small package containing CARDINAL g of heroin was visible in the car near the gear lever . The police seized it .
CARDINAL . DATE a search was conducted in the flat from where the second applicant had come , and where he lived with FAC , his partner . No drugs were found .

CARDINAL . The first applicant was taken into custody for TIME , but released on DATE . While in custody , he was taken to hospital under suspicion that he had swallowed a package of heroin . The treatment did not confirm the suspicions .

CARDINAL . The second applicant was apprehended on DATE after being noticed on the street by PERSON . He was taken into police custody . On DATE the ORG ordered his pre - trial detention for DATE . His detention was subsequently extended by the court DATE until the end of the proceedings before the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant made a statement to the police , in the presence of a lawyer . He admitted to having facilitated the drugs sale between PERSON and the second applicant . He stated that he had taken the money from PERSON and handed it to the second applicant , who had then put a small bag of heroin near the gear lever . He also stated that he had obtained the methadone tablets from a nurse in ORG in exchange for a bag of coffee .
CARDINAL . The prosecution file contains a second statement in the same terms , which is not dated and is signed only by the first applicant . He claimed it had been taken DATE , on his arrest .

CARDINAL . DATE , however , the first applicant , in the presence of his lawyer , changed his position and stated before ORG that he was not a drug dealer and had not taken drugs for DATE . He also stated that ORG had requested him to make the second applicant come out of his house , where the police would be present . He had only agreed to help because he understood that it was a covert police operation . He maintained that an exchange of money for a small bag had occurred between PERSON and the second applicant . He also confirmed that the CARDINAL tablets of methadone were for his own use and that he had obtained them without prescription .

CARDINAL . When interviewed by the prosecutor on CARDINAL and DATE the first applicant took the same position as before ORG . He explained that he had given the statement of DATE thinking that he would be participating in the criminal proceedings only as a witness and not as an accused .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant told the prosecutor that he had not handed anything to the first applicant , that he had not known what the small package found in the car contained and that he had only agreed to accompany the first applicant to the car because the latter had told the second applicant that he had money for the second applicant ’s partner , GPE He also declared that at that moment he had not known that FAC was a drug dealer . On DATE FAC was also arrested for drug trafficking in the context of a separate investigation .
CARDINAL . The second applicant maintained his above statements on DATE before ORG and on DATE in an interview with the prosecutor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office indicted the applicants for possession and sale of dangerous drugs in violation of Law no . CARDINAL . It established , based on the evidence gathered , that the second applicant had given the small bag of heroin to the first applicant , who had handed it to PERSON , and that in exchange PERSON had given him the money , which he had then handed to the second applicant .
CARDINAL . NORP The prosecutor noted that the first applicant had been found guilty of possession and consumption of drugs in DATE and that the second applicant had no known criminal record .

CARDINAL . The applicants gave statements on DATE . The first applicant reiterated that he had only agreed to contact the second applicant because he had been informed of the covert police operation . The second applicant maintained his position and denied trafficking in drugs .
CARDINAL . NORP The undercover agent and the collaborator supported the prosecutor ’s version of the facts and maintained that the first applicant had not been aware of the police operation .

CARDINAL . Some of the witnesses who had been unfavourable to the applicants during the investigations changed their statements before the court and claimed that they had signed without reading statements drafted entirely by the police .

CARDINAL . At the hearing on DATE , after several reminders left unanswered by the prosecutor ’s office , the applicants’ lawyers no longer insisted on obtaining an answer concerning the fate of the bag of heroin released to PERSON for the covert operation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave judgment , acquitting the applicants . It considered that the elements in the file indicated that on DATE the police had sought to provoke a drug sale and had failed . Consequently , the heroin received by PERSON from the prosecutor ’s office had been placed in the car to prove the alleged commission of the criminal offence . The court also noted that the criminal proceedings had been started illegally on CARDINAL DATE as at that date there had been no relevant information on the applicants’ alleged criminal behaviour , and the facts under investigation had only taken place on DATE . It also noted that the exchange of money for drugs was not proved , and that the witnesses could not support the prosecution ’s version . The court ordered the second applicant ’s immediate release .

CARDINAL . On DATE the appeal proceedings started before ORG , on an application lodged by the prosecutor ’s office . ORG heard evidence from the prosecutor and the applicants’ lawyers . The applicants used their right to address the court before the end of the hearing ( ultimul cuvânt al inculpatului ) . No other evidence was requested by the parties or heard by the court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted and sentenced the first applicant to DATE imprisonment and the second applicant to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . It considered that the detailed description of the events made by the undercover agent and the collaborator should have been given more weight as they corroborated the police reports on the arrest in flagrante delicto and thus reflected the truth . The court decided that the first applicant had not been honest in his statements and that he had only claimed to have been aware of the covert police action because he knew from his own experience that collaborators were protected by law . It also concluded that the second applicant ’s aim had been to protract the investigations . The court took the fact that the witnesses changed their position as proof of their dishonesty .
ORG set aside ORG finding of incitement as follows :

“ The court considers , unlike the first - instance court , that LAW and CARDINAL of LAW is not applicable so long as the evidence does not show that PERSON was threatened or coerced to commit the facts . Likewise it is not proved that he was persuaded by the police to commit a crime , ... he agreed to facilitate the drug sale , but no longer admitted to it before the court . ”
It considered the arguments based on the origin of the heroin found as follows :
“ ... PERSON himself stated when apprehended by the police and in subsequent statements that the drugs found in the car had been handed over by PERSON , in exchange for CARDINAL lei . ”
CARDINAL . The first applicant was also convicted of illegal possession of CARDINAL tablets of methadone .

CARDINAL . The court deducted the second applicant ’s preventive detention from “ DATE to CARDINAL DATE ” . It also confiscated , under LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , the CARDINAL tablets of methadone and QUANTITY of heroin left after the laboratory tests from the first and the second applicant respectively .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG and ORG upheld the conviction following an appeal on points of law lodged by the applicants .

It also corrected the material error in the appeal decision concerning the second applicant ’s preventive detention , and in an interlocutory judgment of DATE noted that he had been detained from DATE to CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE and on DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicants lodged criminal complaints against PERSON , the prosecutors in charge of their investigation , the undercover agent and the witnesses alleging that they had given false testimony to the investigative authorities . In addition , the first applicant , in the appeal of DATE , complained that several items adduced by him as evidence had disappeared from the criminal file . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE and DATE the prosecutor ’s office at ORG and ORG decided not to prosecute PERSON and PERSON . On DATE a similar decision was taken in respect of the witnesses by the prosecutor ’s office at ORG .
CARDINAL . DATE of LAW reads as follows :
“ CARDINAL . It is forbidden to use violence , threats or other means of coercion , as well as inducements , in order to obtain evidence .
CARDINAL . It is also forbidden to incite a person to commit or continue committing a criminal offence for the purpose of obtaining evidence . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of Law no . CARDINAL read as follows :
“ In the present Act the terms and expressions below shall have the following meaning :

( k ) Undercover agents : police officers specifically designated to carry out , with the prosecutor ’s authorisation , investigations with a view to collecting data regarding the existence of the offence and the identification of the offender and precursory acts , under another identity than their real one . Such authorisation shall be conferred for a limited time only . ”

“ CARDINAL . The prosecutor may authorise the use of undercover agents to determine the facts , identify the offender and obtain evidence where there is good reason to believe that a criminal offence as defined in the present Act has been perpetrated or is about to be committed . ”

“ CARDINAL . Police officers from the special units who act as undercover agents , as well as persons acting with them , shall be allowed to procure drugs , base and compound chemical substances with the prosecutor ’s prior authorisation , with a view to discovering criminal activities and identifying the persons involved in such activities .
CARDINAL . NORP The results of the actions of the police officers and persons acting with them referred to in paragraph CARDINAL may constitute evidence . ”
